topic.title: Supported FEEL data types in DMN test scenarios

body.p: The IBM BAMOE test scenario modeler supports the following Friendly Enough Expression Language (FEEL) data types for Decision Model and Notation (DMN) test scenarios:

table.title: Supported FEEL data types in DMN test scenarios

entry.p: Numbers based on the IEEE 754-2008 Decimal 128 format, with additional number notations extended by IBM BAMOE, such as 1.2e3 for 1.2*10**3 (scientific) and 0xff for 255 (hexadecimal)
Any sequence of characters delimited by double quotation marks, such as "John Doe", "Brno", and ""
Dates, time, and date and time
Date literals, time literals, and combined date and time literals, such as date("2019-05-13"), time("14:10:00+02:00"), and date and time( "2019-05-13T23:59:00" )
Years and months duration, days and time duration

Duration strings for years, months, days, hours, minutes, and seconds that follow the format defined in the XML Schema Part 2: Datatypes document, such as duration( "P2Y" ) for year, duration( "P3Y5M" ) for year and month, duration( "P23D" ) for days, duration( "PT12H" ) for hours, and duration( "P1DT23H12M30S" ) for days, hours, minutes, and seconds.
Built-in math functions, such as avg and max, or variables of functions extended by IBM BAMOE, such as function(a, b) a + b
Lists of key and value pairs, such as {x : 5, y : 3} and {x : 5, even : false, type : "integer number"}
Range literals and list literals, such as [1 .. 10] and [2, 3, 4, 5]

body.p: For more information about supported test scenario actions and data types, see the Scenario Cheatsheet icon in the right toolbar of the test scenario modeler in Visual Studio Code (VSCode).
For more information about FEEL data types, see DMN FEEL Handbook.
